quest.name: Faded Memories
journal: Thancred is eager to get to work.

While he and the others tend to the black-masked Ascians, Thancred bids you join Y'shtola at Anamnesis Anyder as a precautionary measure. To get there, you will need to secure a boat at Venmont Yards─just as soon as you've doled out Tataru's bread, that is.

At Venmont Yards, a shipwright recognizes you at once and happily agrees to ready a boat for you.

※In the event that you leave the instance, you may re-enter by speaking with the idle shipwright.

To your dismay, you arrive at Anyder to find Y'shtola unconscious. Before you can go to her aid, however, Elidibus appears and spirits her away. If you want your comrade back, it seems you must treat the Ascian to a demonstration of your strength. With no other recourse, you grit your teeth and prepare to enter the aetherial stream.

You ride the aether to emerge in Emet-Selch's phantom Amaurot, where Elidibus instructs you to fight your way to the Capitol. The trial pits you against recreations of myriad faces from your past, and at the last the Ascian himself enters the fray in the guise of Ardbert─yet it soon becomes plain that even he is overmatched.

No sooner does your trial conclude than Y'shtola arrives at your side, having apparently freed herself. Gazing upon Elidibus with a mixture of pity and scorn, she proceeds to expose him for what he truly is: a primal, granted strength by the desire for salvation. Thus has he sought to inspire the masses to rise up as Warriors of Light. Unmoved, the Ascian coolly confirms Y'shtola's theories, but when she subsequently questions whether the many voices that sustain him have irrevocably changed his own, his expression hardens. No matter how much he should forget, he declares, he will always remember his duty. With that, he vanishes, but not before serving notice of his intent to gain the power to defeat you.

The danger now passed, you finally have the chance to apprise Y'shtola of recent events. Having listened to your tale, she goes to collect her possessions from Anyder in preparation for your journey to Eulmore.
objectives: Speak with the idle shipwright at Venmont Yards.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: When our grandfather first decided to journey to Eorzea, Alisaie did not take kindly to my silence on the subject. “Don't pretend to understand things you don't,” she said...or rather shouted.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Having oft been the object of her scorn, I am predisposed to sympathize with the Exarch, but I do understand how she feels─better now than ever I did, certainly.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I know it was childish to storm off like that. And probably to feel the way I do as well. Agh, pull yourself together, Alisaie!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's stupid, but I've never really stopped to think about what would happen once the vessels were complete. And now...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: No. There's no point. I...I hope the test is a success. Truly.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Lest there be any doubt, the Exarch hath long been aware of the possibilities he but recently unfolded to us. Wherefore he did refrain from sharing them until now, I cannot say.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Right then! While the Exarch literally pours his own sweat and blood into his allotted task, it seems only fair that we attend to our own.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Dealing with Elidibus and his minions.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Just so. And there is one other matter.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In light of our deteriorating health, Y'shtola should not be left alone at Anyder. Might I trouble you to visit her, Forename? See that all is well?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I would go myself, but I think she might be safer in the hands of one less prone to collapsing.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: My thanks. You may leave the Ascians to us.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Once they are out of the way, we will retire to Eulmore. And when Y'shtola has finished plumbing the depths, I'd like the two of you to join us there.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If you are bound for Anyder, I suggest you go via Venmont Yards. Our friends there will be glad to provide a boat for you.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Let us be on our way, then. Don't do anything I wouldn't do.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Wait, I have a gift for you, from Tataru.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I have a delivery from the Source, kupo! Courtesy of one Tataru Taru.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: From Tataru, you say? Whatever could it be...?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You're a long way from home, moogle. And this is from Tataru, is it? Whatever could it be...?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Archon loaf, thou sayest? Why, even to hear the name doth transport me to times long past...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Bread from another world!? May I try some?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mayest thou, child? Thou must! ...That said, though I personally disagree with the consensus, I do nonetheless advise thee to temper thine expectations.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Wiser words have never been uttered.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though it rarely darkened our dining table at home, I can attest that it was standard fare at the Studium. Indeed, a slice was never far from our peers' hands.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, you really are an unbearable snob sometimes, do you know that?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What I believe my colleagues are trying to say is that we appreciate the gesture. Tell Tataru we'll do our best to return before she's forced to seek further supplementary employment.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Right, let's really be off now. We can find a drink to wash down the bread on the way.

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT03775
dialogue.text: Oho, if it ain't the Warrior of Darkness herselfhimself! What brings you to these parts?

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT03775
dialogue.text: Headin' out to sea, eh? But of course we'd be happy to help! Just say the word, and I'll ready a boat.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Travel to Anyder?

dialogue.name: SHIPWRIGHT03775
dialogue.text: Oh, you're back. Headin' out again, are you?

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: You are familiar with this place, I believe. This...remembered Amaurot.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Capitol. I shall return your comrade to you there.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Enough of this!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I tire of your games.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: You speak as if you were disappointed in me. Why?

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: I am your enemy, and you mine. Our goals are in conflict, and we are fated to clash.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: Or had you hoped that feigned sympathy and false understanding would cast your crimes in a less reprehensible light? That I would come to look upon you as a friend?

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: You who have slaughtered my people. Who would tear down everything we have built.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: You do not deny it, then. Very well, let us change the cast of this trial. You will know what you have stolen from us.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: But do not imagine I crave remorse. Only justice.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: An impressive show of strength.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: But surely no more than a foretaste of that which Emet-Selch's conqueror is capable.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: Such might requires a fairer measure. To compare like with like. Yes...

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: I shall just have to test you myself.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: (-Ardbert-)Come on, Forename! Show me what you can do!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It has been an eventful morning─if indeed it is morning. I've no idea how long I was unconscious.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Regardless, I am gratified to see that my efforts at Anyder have borne fruit. We have confirmed the nature of our foe and his plot.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now then, what news from the surface?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I see. Then let us make for Eulmore at once. We have much to share with our comrades, Elidibus's parting threat not least of all.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Ah, but forgive me. It would seem my belongings did not accompany me here. I will need to retrieve them from Anyder.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: With luck, the aetherial stream you traversed still lingers. I won't be long.
